Description: Part of a very broad ivory bangle: triangular in section, bevelled on the outside and slightly convex on the inner. There are two other fragments, one quite large, from this same bangle, but it is impossible to join them to the largest fragment.
Dimensions: Diameter: 8.70 centimetres (approx. size of complete bangle)
Length: 5.09 centimetres (fragment marked with identification numbers)
Curator's comments: Bibliography: G. Brunton & G. Caton-Thompson, ‘The Badarian Civilization’ (London, 1928), 8, 30; pl. XXIII, 17; Grave register, pl. V.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (8)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
